title: Assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand
summary: On June 28, 1914, Archduke Franz Ferdinand, heir to the Austro-Hungarian throne, was assassinated in Sarajevo by Gavrilo Princip, a Bosnian-Serb nationalist. The killing set off a chain of diplomatic failures and alliance obligations that plunged Europe into World War I within weeks, a conflict that killed over 17 million people and reshaped the world's political map.
